## LookAtParams interface

Parameters for \[\[MapView.lookAt\]\].

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface LookAtParams 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [bounds](./harp-mapview.lookatparams.bounds.md) | [GeoBox](./harp-geoutils.geobox.md) \| [GeoBoxExtentLike](./harp-geoutils.geoboxextentlike.md) \| [GeoCoordLike](./harp-geoutils.geocoordlike.md)<!-- -->\[\] | Fit MapView to these boundaries.<!-- -->If specified, <code>zoomLevel</code> and <code>distance</code> parameters are ignored and <code>lookAt</code> calculates best <code>zoomLevel</code> to fit given bounds.<!-- -->\* if <code>bounds</code> is \[\[GeoBox\]\], then <code>lookAt</code> use \[\[LookAtParams.target\]\] or <code>bounds.target</code> and ensure whole box is visible<!-- -->\* if <code>bounds</code> is \[\[GeoBoxExtentLike\]\], then <code>lookAt</code> will use \[\[LookAtParams.target\]\] or current \[\[MapView.target\]\] and ensure whole extents are visible<!-- -->\* if <code>bounds</code> is \[\[GeoCoordLike\]\]\[\], then <code>lookAt</code> will use \[\[LookAtParams.target\]\] or calculated <code>target</code> as center of world box covering given points and ensure all points are visible<!-- -->Note in sphere projection some points are not visible if you specify bounds that span more than 180 degreess in any direction. \[\[MapView.lookAt\]\] for defails how <code>bounds</code> interact with <code>target</code> parameter |
|  [distance](./harp-mapview.lookatparams.distance.md) | number | Camera distance to the target point in world units.  zoomLevel defaults will be used if not set. |
|  [heading](./harp-mapview.lookatparams.heading.md) | number | Heading angle in degrees and clockwise. 0 is north-up.  0 in \[\[MapView.constructor\]\] context.  \[\[MapView.heading\]\] in \[\[MapView.lookAt\]\] context. |
|  [target](./harp-mapview.lookatparams.target.md) | [GeoCoordLike](./harp-geoutils.geocoordlike.md) | Target/look at point of the MapView. If the given point is not on the ground (altitude != 0) \[\[MapView\]\] will do a raycasting internally to find a target on the ground.<!-- -->As a consequence \[\[MapView.target\]\] and \[\[MapView.zoomLevel\]\] will not match the values that were passed into the \[\[MapView.lookAt\]\] method.  <code>new GeoCoordinates(25, 0)</code> in \[\[MapView.constructor\]\] context.  \[\[MapView.target\]\] in \[\[MapView.lookAt\]\] context. |
|  [tilt](./harp-mapview.lookatparams.tilt.md) | number | Tilt angle in degrees. 0 is top down view.  0 in \[\[MapView.constructor\]\] context.  \[\[MapView.tilt\]\] in \[\[MapView.lookAt\]\] context.  Maximum supported tilt is 89Â° |
|  [zoomLevel](./harp-mapview.lookatparams.zoomlevel.md) | number | Zoomlevel of the MapView.  Takes precedence over distance.  5 in \[\[MapView.constructor\]\] context.  \[\[MapView.zoomLevel\]\] in \[\[MapView.lookAt\]\] context. |
